Instruction: If using wooden skewers, soak them in water for at least 30 minutes to prevent burning.
Slice the pork loin or tenderloin into thin strips, about 1/4 inch thick.
In a bowl, combine coconut milk, soy sauce, brown sugar, lime juice, curry powder, minced garlic, and grated ginger to make the marinade.
Place the sliced pork in the marinade, making sure each piece is well coated. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight for best results.
Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Thread the marinated pork strips onto the skewers, leaving some space between each piece.
Grill the pork satay skewers for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked through and have grill marks.
Once cooked, remove the pork satay skewers from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
Serve the pork satay hot with peanut sauce on the side for dipping, if desired.
